CWE-1021.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames
CWE-1021.description: The web application does not restrict or incorrectly restricts frame objects or UI layers that belong to another application or domain, which can lead to user confusion about which interface the user is interacting with.

CWE-113.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')
CWE-113.description: The product receives data from an HTTP agent/component (e.g., web server, proxy, browser, etc.), but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes CR and LF characters before the data is included in outgoing HTTP headers.

CWE-114.name: Process Control
CWE-114.description: Executing commands or loading libraries from an untrusted source or in an untrusted environment can cause an application to execute malicious commands (and payloads) on behalf of an attacker.

CWE-117.name: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs
CWE-117.description: The product constructs a log message from external input, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements when the message is written to a log file.

CWE-1188.name: Initialization of a Resource with an Insecure Default
CWE-1188.description: The product initializes or sets a resource with a default that is intended to be changed by the product's installer, administrator, or maintainer, but the default is not secure.

CWE-1190.name: DMA Device Enabled Too Early in Boot Phase
CWE-1190.description: The product enables a Direct Memory Access (DMA) capable device before the security configuration settings are established, which allows an attacker to extract data from or gain privileges on the product.

CWE-1191.name: On-Chip Debug and Test Interface With Improper Access Control
CWE-1191.description: The chip does not implement or does not correctly perform access control to check whether users are authorized to access internal registers and test modes through the physical debug/test interface.

CWE-1193.name: Power-On of Untrusted Execution Core Before Enabling Fabric Access Control
CWE-1193.description: The product enables components that contain untrusted firmware before memory and fabric access controls have been enabled.

CWE-1220.name: Insufficient Granularity of Access Control
CWE-1220.description: The product implements access controls via a policy or other feature with the intention to disable or restrict accesses (reads and/or writes) to assets in a system from untrusted agents. However, implemented access controls lack required granularity, which renders the control policy too broad because it allows accesses from unauthorized agents to the security-sensitive assets.

CWE-1239.name: Improper Zeroization of Hardware Register
CWE-1239.description: The hardware product does not properly clear sensitive information from built-in registers when the user of the hardware block changes.

CWE-1243.name: Sensitive Non-Volatile Information Not Protected During Debug
CWE-1243.description: Access to security-sensitive information stored in fuses is not limited during debug.

CWE-1244.name: Internal Asset Exposed to Unsafe Debug Access Level or State
CWE-1244.description:
The product uses physical debug or test
        interfaces with support for multiple access levels, but it
        assigns the wrong debug access level to an internal asset,
        providing unintended access to the asset from untrusted debug
        agents.

CWE-1258.name: Exposure of Sensitive System Information Due to Uncleared Debug Information
CWE-1258.description: The hardware does not fully clear security-sensitive values, such as keys and intermediate values in cryptographic operations, when debug mode is entered.

CWE-1264.name: Hardware Logic with Insecure De-Synchronization between Control and Data Channels
CWE-1264.description: The hardware logic for error handling and security checks can incorrectly forward data before the security check is complete.

CWE-1266.name: Improper Scrubbing of Sensitive Data from Decommissioned Device
CWE-1266.description: The product does not properly provide a capability for the product administrator to remove sensitive data at the time the product is decommissioned.  A scrubbing capability could be missing, insufficient, or incorrect.

CWE-1268.name: Policy Privileges are not Assigned Consistently Between Control and Data Agents
CWE-1268.description: The product's hardware-enforced access control for a particular resource improperly accounts for privilege discrepancies between control and write policies.

CWE-1269.name: Product Released in Non-Release Configuration
CWE-1269.description: The product released to market is released in pre-production or manufacturing configuration.

CWE-1270.name: Generation of Incorrect Security Tokens
CWE-1270.description: The product implements a Security Token mechanism to differentiate what actions are allowed or disallowed when a transaction originates from an entity. However, the Security Tokens generated in the system are incorrect.

CWE-1272.name: Sensitive Information Uncleared Before Debug/Power State Transition
CWE-1272.description: The product performs a power or debug state transition, but it does not clear sensitive information that should no longer be accessible due to changes to information access restrictions.

CWE-1273.name: Device Unlock Credential Sharing
CWE-1273.description: The credentials necessary for unlocking a device are shared across multiple parties and may expose sensitive information.

CWE-1278.name: Missing Protection Against Hardware Reverse Engineering Using Integrated Circuit (IC) Imaging Techniques
CWE-1278.description: Information stored in hardware may be recovered by an attacker with the capability to capture and analyze images of the integrated circuit using techniques such as scanning electron microscopy.

CWE-1280.name: Access Control Check Implemented After Asset is Accessed
CWE-1280.description: A product's hardware-based access control check occurs after the asset has been accessed.

CWE-1297.name: Unprotected Confidential Information on Device is Accessible by OSAT Vendors
CWE-1297.description: The product does not adequately protect confidential information on the device from being accessed by Outsourced Semiconductor Assembly and Test (OSAT) vendors.

CWE-1299.name: Missing Protection Mechanism for Alternate Hardware Interface
CWE-1299.description:
The lack of protections on alternate paths to access
                control-protected assets (such as unprotected shadow registers
                and other external facing unguarded interfaces) allows an
                attacker to bypass existing protections to the asset that are
		only performed against the primary path.

CWE-1301.name: Insufficient or Incomplete Data Removal within Hardware Component
CWE-1301.description: The product's data removal process does not completely delete all data and potentially sensitive information within hardware components.

CWE-1311.name: Improper Translation of Security Attributes by Fabric Bridge
CWE-1311.description: The bridge incorrectly translates security attributes from either trusted to untrusted or from untrusted to trusted when converting from one fabric protocol to another.

CWE-1314.name: Missing Write Protection for Parametric Data Values
CWE-1314.description: The device does not write-protect the parametric data values for sensors that scale the sensor value, allowing untrusted software to manipulate the apparent result and potentially damage hardware or cause operational failure.

CWE-1315.name: Improper Setting of Bus Controlling Capability in Fabric End-point
CWE-1315.description: The bus controller enables bits in the fabric end-point to allow responder devices to control transactions on the fabric.

CWE-1317.name: Improper Access Control in Fabric Bridge
CWE-1317.description: The product uses a fabric bridge for transactions between two Intellectual Property (IP) blocks, but the bridge does not properly perform the expected privilege, identity, or other access control checks between those IP blocks.

CWE-1318.name: Missing Support for Security Features in On-chip Fabrics or Buses
CWE-1318.description: On-chip fabrics or buses either do not support or are not configured to support privilege separation or other security features, such as access control.

CWE-1320.name: Improper Protection for Outbound Error Messages and Alert Signals
CWE-1320.description: Untrusted agents can disable alerts about signal conditions exceeding limits or the response mechanism that handles such alerts.

CWE-1321.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')
CWE-1321.description: The product receives input from an upstream component that specifies attributes that are to be initialized or updated in an object, but it does not properly control modifications of attributes of the object prototype.

CWE-1322.name: Use of Blocking Code in Single-threaded, Non-blocking Context
CWE-1322.description:
The product uses a non-blocking model that relies on a single threaded process
			for features such as scalability, but it contains code that can block when it is invoked.

CWE-1323.name: Improper Management of Sensitive Trace Data
CWE-1323.description:
Trace data collected from several sources on the
                System-on-Chip (SoC) is stored in unprotected locations or
                transported to untrusted agents.

CWE-1325.name: Improperly Controlled Sequential Memory Allocation
CWE-1325.description: The product manages a group of objects or resources and performs a separate memory allocation for each object, but it does not properly limit the total amount of memory that is consumed by all of the combined objects.

CWE-1327.name: Binding to an Unrestricted IP Address
CWE-1327.description: The product assigns the address 0.0.0.0 for a database server, a cloud service/instance, or any computing resource that communicates remotely.

CWE-1330.name: Remanent Data Readable after Memory Erase
CWE-1330.description: Confidential information stored in memory circuits is readable or recoverable after being cleared or erased.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-15.name: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
CWE-15.description: One or more system settings or configuration elements can be externally controlled by a user.

CWE-162.name: Improper Neutralization of Trailing Special Elements
CWE-162.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes trailing special elements that could be interpreted in unexpected ways when they are sent to a downstream component.

CWE-172.name: Encoding Error
CWE-172.description: The product does not properly encode or decode the data, resulting in unexpected values.

CWE-173.name: Improper Handling of Alternate Encoding
CWE-173.description: The product does not properly handle when an input uses an alternate encoding that is valid for the control sphere to which the input is being sent.

CWE-180.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Canonicalize
CWE-180.description: The product validates input before it is canonicalized, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the canonicalization step.

CWE-181.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Validate Before Filter
CWE-181.description: The product validates data before it has been filtered, which prevents the product from detecting data that becomes invalid after the filtering step.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-20.name: Improper Input Validation
CWE-20.description:
The product receives input or data, but it does
        not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the
        properties that are required to process the data safely and
        correctly.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-200.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
CWE-200.description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

CWE-226.name: Sensitive Information in Resource Not Removed Before Reuse
CWE-226.description: The product releases a resource such as memory or a file so that it can be made available for reuse, but it does not clear or "zeroize" the information contained in the resource before the product performs a critical state transition or makes the resource available for reuse by other entities.

CWE-257.name: Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format
CWE-257.description: The storage of passwords in a recoverable format makes them subject to password reuse attacks by malicious users. In fact, it should be noted that recoverable encrypted passwords provide no significant benefit over plaintext passwords since they are subject not only to reuse by malicious attackers but also by malicious insiders. If a system administrator can recover a password directly, or use a brute force search on the available information, the administrator can use the password on other accounts.

CWE-261.name: Weak Encoding for Password
CWE-261.description: Obscuring a password with a trivial encoding does not protect the password.

CWE-262.name: Not Using Password Aging
CWE-262.description: The product does not have a mechanism in place for managing password aging.

CWE-263.name: Password Aging with Long Expiration
CWE-263.description: The product supports password aging, but the expiration period is too long.

CWE-267.name: Privilege Defined With Unsafe Actions
CWE-267.description: A particular privilege, role, capability, or right can be used to perform unsafe actions that were not intended, even when it is assigned to the correct entity.

CWE-269.name: Improper Privilege Management
CWE-269.description: The product does not properly assign, modify, track, or check privileges for an actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

CWE-270.name: Privilege Context Switching Error
CWE-270.description: The product does not properly manage privileges while it is switching between different contexts that have different privileges or spheres of control.

CWE-272.name: Least Privilege Violation
CWE-272.description: The elevated privilege level required to perform operations such as chroot() should be dropped immediately after the operation is performed.

CWE-276.name: Incorrect Default Permissions
CWE-276.description: During installation, installed file permissions are set to allow anyone to modify those files.

CWE-282.name: Improper Ownership Management
CWE-282.description: The product assigns the wrong ownership, or does not properly verify the ownership, of an object or resource.

CWE-284.name: Improper Access Control
CWE-284.description: The product does not restrict or incorrectly restricts access to a resource from an unauthorized actor.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-285.name: Improper Authorization
CWE-285.description: The product does not perform or incorrectly performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

CWE-287.name: Improper Authentication
CWE-287.description: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the product does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

CWE-288.name: Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel
CWE-288.description: The product requires authentication, but the product has an alternate path or channel that does not require authentication.

CWE-290.name: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
CWE-290.description: This attack-focused weakness is caused by incorrectly implemented authentication schemes that are subject to spoofing attacks.

CWE-294.name: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
CWE-294.description: A capture-replay flaw exists when the design of the product makes it possible for a malicious user to sniff network traffic and bypass authentication by replaying it to the server in question to the same effect as the original message (or with minor changes).

CWE-300.name: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
CWE-300.description: The product does not adequately verify the identity of actors at both ends of a communication channel, or does not adequately ensure the integrity of the channel, in a way that allows the channel to be accessed or influenced by an actor that is not an endpoint.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-302.name: Authentication Bypass by Assumed-Immutable Data
CWE-302.description: The authentication scheme or implementation uses key data elements that are assumed to be immutable, but can be controlled or modified by the attacker.

CWE-307.name: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts
CWE-307.description: The product does not implement sufficient measures to prevent multiple failed authentication attempts within a short time frame.

CWE-308.name: Use of Single-factor Authentication
CWE-308.description: The product uses an authentication algorithm that uses a single factor (e.g., a password) in a security context that should require more than one factor.

CWE-309.name: Use of Password System for Primary Authentication
CWE-309.description: The use of password systems as the primary means of authentication may be subject to several flaws or shortcomings, each reducing the effectiveness of the mechanism.

CWE-311.name: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
CWE-311.description: The product does not encrypt sensitive or critical information before storage or transmission.

CWE-312.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
CWE-312.description: The product stores sensitive information in cleartext within a resource that might be accessible to another control sphere.

CWE-314.name: Cleartext Storage in the Registry
CWE-314.description: The product stores sensitive information in cleartext in the registry.

CWE-315.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information in a Cookie
CWE-315.description: The product stores sensitive information in cleartext in a cookie.

CWE-318.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information in Executable
CWE-318.description: The product stores sensitive information in cleartext in an executable.

CWE-319.name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
CWE-319.description: The product transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be sniffed by unauthorized actors.

CWE-326.name: Inadequate Encryption Strength
CWE-326.description: The product stores or transmits sensitive data using an encryption scheme that is theoretically sound, but is not strong enough for the level of protection required.

CWE-327.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
CWE-327.description: The product uses a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm or protocol.

CWE-330.name: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
CWE-330.description: The product uses insufficiently random numbers or values in a security context that depends on unpredictable numbers.

CWE-345.name: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
CWE-345.description: The product does not sufficiently verify the origin or authenticity of data, in a way that causes it to accept invalid data.

CWE-346.name: Origin Validation Error
CWE-346.description: The product does not properly verify that the source of data or communication is valid.

CWE-348.name: Use of Less Trusted Source
CWE-348.description: The product has two different sources of the same data or information, but it uses the source that has less support for verification, is less trusted, or is less resistant to attack.

CWE-349.name: Acceptance of Extraneous Untrusted Data With Trusted Data
CWE-349.description: The product, when processing trusted data, accepts any untrusted data that is also included with the trusted data, treating the untrusted data as if it were trusted.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-353.name: Missing Support for Integrity Check
CWE-353.description: The product uses a transmission protocol that does not include a mechanism for verifying the integrity of the data during transmission, such as a checksum.

CWE-359.name: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
CWE-359.description: The product does not properly prevent a person's private, personal information from being accessed by actors who either (1) are not explicitly authorized to access the information or (2) do not have the implicit consent of the person about whom the information is collected.

CWE-384.name: Session Fixation
CWE-384.description: Authenticating a user, or otherwise establishing a new user session, without invalidating any existing session identifier gives an attacker the opportunity to steal authenticated sessions.

CWE-400.name: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
CWE-400.description: The product does not properly control the allocation and maintenance of a limited resource.

CWE-404.name: Improper Resource Shutdown or Release
CWE-404.description: The product does not release or incorrectly releases a resource before it is made available for re-use.

CWE-412.name: Unrestricted Externally Accessible Lock
CWE-412.description: The product properly checks for the existence of a lock, but the lock can be externally controlled or influenced by an actor that is outside of the intended sphere of control.

CWE-425.name: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing')
CWE-425.description: The web application does not adequately enforce appropriate authorization on all restricted URLs, scripts, or files.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-426.name: Untrusted Search Path
CWE-426.description: The product searches for critical resources using an externally-supplied search path that can point to resources that are not under the product's direct control.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable
Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

CWE-427.name: Uncontrolled Search Path Element
CWE-427.description: The product uses a fixed or controlled search path to find resources, but one or more locations in that path can be under the control of unintended actors.

CWE-434.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
CWE-434.description: The product allows the upload or transfer of dangerous file types that are automatically processed within its environment.

CWE-441.name: Unintended Proxy or Intermediary ('Confused Deputy')
CWE-441.description: The product receives a request, message, or directive from an upstream component, but the product does not sufficiently preserve the original source of the request before forwarding the request to an external actor that is outside of the product's control sphere. This causes the product to appear to be the source of the request, leading it to act as a proxy or other intermediary between the upstream component and the external actor.

CWE-451.name: User Interface (UI) Misrepresentation of Critical Information
CWE-451.description: The user interface (UI) does not properly represent critical information to the user, allowing the information - or its source - to be obscured or spoofed. This is often a component in phishing attacks.

CWE-472.name: External Control of Assumed-Immutable Web Parameter
CWE-472.description: The web application does not sufficiently verify inputs that are assumed to be immutable but are actually externally controllable, such as hidden form fields.

CWE-488.name: Exposure of Data Element to Wrong Session
CWE-488.description: The product does not sufficiently enforce boundaries between the states of different sessions, causing data to be provided to, or used by, the wrong session.

techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools

CWE-494.name: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
CWE-494.description: The product downloads source code or an executable from a remote location and executes the code without sufficiently verifying the origin and integrity of the code.

techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools

CWE-506.name: Embedded Malicious Code
CWE-506.description: The product contains code that appears to be malicious in nature.

CWE-507.name: Trojan Horse
CWE-507.description: The product appears to contain benign or useful functionality, but it also contains code that is hidden from normal operation that violates the intended security policy of the user or the system administrator.

CWE-521.name: Weak Password Requirements
CWE-521.description: The product does not require that users should have strong passwords.

CWE-522.name: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
CWE-522.description: The product transmits or stores authentication credentials, but it uses an insecure method that is susceptible to unauthorized interception and/or retrieval.

CWE-524.name: Use of Cache Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-524.description: The code uses a cache that contains sensitive information, but the cache can be read by an actor outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-525.name: Use of Web Browser Cache Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-525.description: The web application does not use an appropriate caching policy that specifies the extent to which each web page and associated form fields should be cached.

CWE-539.name: Use of Persistent Cookies Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-539.description: The web application uses persistent cookies, but the cookies contain sensitive information.

CWE-552.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
CWE-552.description: The product makes files or directories accessible to unauthorized actors, even though they should not be.

CWE-553.name: Command Shell in Externally Accessible Directory
CWE-553.description: A possible shell file exists in /cgi-bin/ or other accessible directories. This is extremely dangerous and can be used by an attacker to execute commands on the web server.

CWE-565.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking
CWE-565.description: The product relies on the existence or values of cookies when performing security-critical operations, but it does not properly ensure that the setting is valid for the associated user.

CWE-567.name: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context
CWE-567.description: The product does not properly synchronize shared data, such as static variables across threads, which can lead to undefined behavior and unpredictable data changes.

CWE-59.name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
CWE-59.description: The product attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

CWE-593.name: Authentication Bypass: OpenSSL CTX Object Modified after SSL Objects are Created
CWE-593.description: The product modifies the SSL context after connection creation has begun.

CWE-6.name: J2EE Misconfiguration: Insufficient Session-ID Length
CWE-6.description: The J2EE application is configured to use an insufficient session ID length.

CWE-602.name: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
CWE-602.description: The product is composed of a server that relies on the client to implement a mechanism that is intended to protect the server.

CWE-642.name: External Control of Critical State Data
CWE-642.description: The product stores security-critical state information about its users, or the product itself, in a location that is accessible to unauthorized actors.

CWE-654.name: Reliance on a Single Factor in a Security Decision
CWE-654.description: A protection mechanism relies exclusively, or to a large extent, on the evaluation of a single condition or the integrity of a single object or entity in order to make a decision about granting access to restricted resources or functionality.

CWE-662.name: Improper Synchronization
CWE-662.description: The product utilizes multiple threads, processes, components, or systems to allow temporary access to a shared resource that can only be exclusive to one process at a time, but it does not properly synchronize these actions, which might cause simultaneous accesses of this resource by multiple threads or processes.

CWE-664.name: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime
CWE-664.description: The product does not maintain or incorrectly maintains control over a resource throughout its lifetime of creation, use, and release.

CWE-667.name: Improper Locking
CWE-667.description: The product does not properly acquire or release a lock on a resource, leading to unexpected resource state changes and behaviors.

CWE-692.name: Incomplete Denylist to Cross-Site Scripting
CWE-692.description: The product uses a denylist-based protection mechanism to defend against XSS attacks, but the denylist is incomplete, allowing XSS variants to succeed.

CWE-693.name: Protection Mechanism Failure
CWE-693.description: The product does not use or incorrectly uses a protection mechanism that provides sufficient defense against directed attacks against the product.

CWE-697.name: Incorrect Comparison
CWE-697.description: The product compares two entities in a security-relevant context, but the comparison is incorrect.

techniques.name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

CWE-706.name: Use of Incorrectly-Resolved Name or Reference
CWE-706.description: The product uses a name or reference to access a resource, but the name/reference resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-73.name: External Control of File Name or Path
CWE-73.description: The product allows user input to control or influence paths or file names that are used in filesystem operations.

CWE-732.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
CWE-732.description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

techniques.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

CWE-74.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
CWE-74.description: The product constructs all or part of a command, data structure, or record using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify how it is parsed or interpreted when it is sent to a downstream component.

CWE-770.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
CWE-770.description: The product allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of an actor without imposing any intended restrictions on the size or number of resources that can be allocated.

CWE-772.name: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
CWE-772.description: The product does not release a resource after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the resource is no longer needed.

CWE-798.name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
CWE-798.description: The product contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key.

techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools

CWE-829.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
CWE-829.description: The product imports, requires, or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-833.name: Deadlock
CWE-833.description: The product contains multiple threads or executable segments that are waiting for each other to release a necessary lock, resulting in deadlock.

CWE-836.name: Use of Password Hash Instead of Password for Authentication
CWE-836.description: The product records password hashes in a data store, receives a hash of a password from a client, and compares the supplied hash to the hash obtained from the data store.

CWE-862.name: Missing Authorization
CWE-862.description: The product does not perform an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

CWE-916.name: Use of Password Hash With Insufficient Computational Effort
CWE-916.description: The product generates a hash for a password, but it uses a scheme that does not provide a sufficient level of computational effort that would make password cracking attacks infeasible or expensive.

CWE-923.name: Improper Restriction of Communication Channel to Intended Endpoints
CWE-923.description: The product establishes a communication channel to (or from) an endpoint for privileged or protected operations, but it does not properly ensure that it is communicating with the correct endpoint.

CWE-94.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
CWE-94.description: The product constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.

CWE-95.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
CWE-95.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes code syntax before using the input in a dynamic evaluation call (e.g. "eval").

CWE-96.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')
CWE-96.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes code syntax before inserting the input into an executable resource, such as a library, configuration file, or template.

CWE-97.name: Improper Neutralization of Server-Side Includes (SSI) Within a Web Page
CWE-97.description: The product generates a web page, but does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input that could be interpreted as a server-side include (SSI) directive.
